m_szDocTitle: Spain’s Generation Mix: Almost 70% Carbon-Free | CleanTechnica
m_szDocSumamry: Spain’s Generation Mix: Almost 70% Carbon-Free April 8th, 2015 by Guest Contributor   Originally published on EnergyPost . (Editor’s Note: 2nd chart added.) Spain gets 69% of its electricity generation from zero-carbon sources, reported the country’s grid operator , Red Electrica de Espana (REE), on the 31st of March. The largest source of carbon-free electricity is nuclear power (23.8%), followed by wind (22.5%). The figures apply only to March 2015. For the whole of 2015, wind still tops nuclear. Spain has a 40% wind target for 2020.     Get CleanTechnica’s 1st (completely free) electric car
